bib.title: Measurement Of The Prompt Neutron Spectrum Of U-238Fission.

free_txt: HI-13 Tandem Van der Graaff accelerator.
HW
SD:Updated to new date formats,lower case.
The measured spectrum was fitted by a Maxwellian
distribution.
Fission fragments were detected by a
parallel-plate ionization chamber which operated in
multi-segment mode and was filled with pure methane at
a pressure of 4.3 atm. Fission neutrons were detected
by two shielded liquid scintillators of 25 cm in diam.
5 cm thick. Both placed at 100 degrees with respect
to the incident neutron beam and at 2.3 m from the
ionization chamber.
The error refers to the uncertainties due to
* counting statistics and
* determination of detector efficiency.
HI-13 Tandem Van der Graaff accelerator.
Neutrons were produced by bombarding a deuterium
gas cell ( 4.3 atm.) with a 7.4 MeV pulsed deuteron
beam.
The incident-neutron TOF spectrum was
obtained from the fission-fragment event signals with
the pulsed-beam TOF method. A liquid scintillator,
located at 0 deg and 3.1 m down stream of the gas cell
served as monitor of the incident-neutron tof spectrum.
Fission neutrons were selected by requiring coincidence
between neutron detector-  and fission-fragment detec-
tor events, which also provided the fission-neutron TOF
spectra. Events induced by 10 MeV incident neutrons
were software selected by gating the TOF spectrum of
secundary neutrons with the 10 MeV peak of the incident
neutron spectrum. Pulse-shape discrimination was
applied to eliminate gamma-ray background.
Natural uranium electro-deposited on both sides of
0.2 mm thick plates of stainless steel with deposition
thickness of about 0.5 mg/cm**2.
Data are taken from Beijing Intern. Symposium
on Fast Neutron Physics, Beijing, 9 - 13 Sept. 1991,
